intro: Azorella triacantha var. famatinensis, commonly known as the Famatinian cushion plant, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are thick and succulent, adapted to survive in high-altitude, arid environments. Azorella triacantha var. famatinensis is well-known for its ability to form extensive cushions that can persist for decades, making it an important component of alpine ecosystems.
